intro: Veronica guentheri, commonly known as Guenther's speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in rocky or sandy soils. It is often found in alpine and arid environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
